message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CL 

The paper proposes a bottom-up approach that uses search data to uncover and gain insight into health information needs in Africa. This involves analyzing Bing searches related to HIV/AIDS, malaria, and tuberculosis from all 54 African nations. The paper focuses on the analysis of search queries and the automatic derivation of common search themes or topics, which suggests a strong emphasis on information needs and retrieval. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Additionally, the paper also involves analyzing search data to uncover patterns by demographic groups and country, which suggests a focus on data analysis and machine learning. This could place the paper in sub-categories such as cs.CY (Computers and Society), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.SD (Software Engineering), and cs.CL (Computation and Language).
